trans-unit.source: Use the Hive shell in HDInsight (Hadoop) | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use the Hive shell in HDInsight (Hadoop) | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use the Hive shell with a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use the Hive shell with a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: You will learn how to connect to the HDInsight cluster using SSh, then use the Hive Shell to interactively run queries.
trans-unit.target: You will learn how to connect to the HDInsight cluster using SSh, then use the Hive Shell to interactively run queries.

trans-unit.source: Use Hive with Hadoop in HDInsight with SSH
trans-unit.target: Use Hive with Hadoop in HDInsight with SSH

trans-unit.source: In this article, you will learn how to use Secure Shell (SSH) to connect to a Hadoop on Azure HDInsight cluster and then interactively submit Hive queries by using the Hive command-line interface (CLI).
trans-unit.target: In this article, you will learn how to use Secure Shell (SSH) to connect to a Hadoop on Azure HDInsight cluster and then interactively submit Hive queries by using the Hive command-line interface (CLI).

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] While the Hive command is available on Linux-based HDInsight clusters, you should consider using Beeline.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.IMPORTANT] While the Hive command is available on Linux-based HDInsight clusters, you should consider using Beeline.

trans-unit.source: Beeline is a newer client for working with Hive, and is included with your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Beeline is a newer client for working with Hive, and is included with your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using this, see [Use Hive with Hadoop in HDInsight with Beeline](hdinsight-hadoop-use-hive-beeline.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using this, see [Use Hive with Hadoop in HDInsight with Beeline](hdinsight-hadoop-use-hive-beeline.md).

trans-unit.source: Prerequisites
trans-unit.target: Prerequisites

trans-unit.source: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:
trans-unit.target: To complete the steps in this article, you will need the following:

trans-unit.source: A Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: A Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: An SSH client.
trans-unit.target: An SSH client.

trans-unit.source: Linux, Unix, and Mac OS should come with an SSH client.
trans-unit.target: Linux, Unix, and Mac OS should come with an SSH client.

trans-unit.source: Windows users must download a client, such as [PuTTY](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html).
trans-unit.target: Windows users must download a client, such as [PuTTY](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html).

trans-unit.source: Connect with SSH
trans-unit.target: Connect with SSH

trans-unit.source: Connect to the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of your HDInsight cluster by using the SSH command.
trans-unit.target: Connect to the fully qualified domain name (FQDN) of your HDInsight cluster by using the SSH command.

trans-unit.source: The FQDN will be the name you gave the cluster, then **.azurehdinsight.net**.
trans-unit.target: The FQDN will be the name you gave the cluster, then **.azurehdinsight.net**.

trans-unit.source: For example, the following would connect to a cluster named **myhdinsight**:
trans-unit.target: For example, the following would connect to a cluster named **myhdinsight**:

trans-unit.source: **If you provided a certificate key for SSH authentication** when you created the HDInsight cluster, you may need to specify the location of the private key on your client system:
trans-unit.target: **If you provided a certificate key for SSH authentication** when you created the HDInsight cluster, you may need to specify the location of the private key on your client system:

trans-unit.source: **If you provided a password for SSH authentication** when you created the HDInsight cluster, you will need to provide the password when prompted.
trans-unit.target: **If you provided a password for SSH authentication** when you created the HDInsight cluster, you will need to provide the password when prompted.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, OS X, and Unix](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, OS X, and Unix](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-unix.md).

trans-unit.source: PuTTY (Windows-based clients)
trans-unit.target: PuTTY (Windows-based clients)

trans-unit.source: Windows does not provide a built-in SSH client.
trans-unit.target: Windows does not provide a built-in SSH client.

trans-unit.source: We recommend using **PuTTY**, which can be downloaded from [http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html).
trans-unit.target: We recommend using **PuTTY**, which can be downloaded from [http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html](http://www.chiark.greenend.org.uk/~sgtatham/putty/download.html).

trans-unit.source: For more information on using PuTTY, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows ](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using PuTTY, see [Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows ](hdinsight-hadoop-linux-use-ssh-windows.md).

trans-unit.source: Use the Hive command
trans-unit.target: Use the Hive command

trans-unit.source: Once connected, start the Hive CLI by using the following command:
trans-unit.target: Once connected, start the Hive CLI by using the following command:

trans-unit.source: Using the CLI, enter the following statements to create a new table named **log4jLogs** by using the sample data:
trans-unit.target: Using the CLI, enter the following statements to create a new table named **log4jLogs** by using the sample data:

trans-unit.source: These statements perform the following actions:
trans-unit.target: These statements perform the following actions:

trans-unit.source: **DROP TABLE** - Deletes the table and the data file, in case the table already exists.
trans-unit.target: **DROP TABLE** - Deletes the table and the data file, in case the table already exists.

trans-unit.source: **CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE** - Creates a new 'external' table in Hive.
trans-unit.target: **CREATE EXTERNAL TABLE** - Creates a new 'external' table in Hive.

trans-unit.source: External tables only store the table definition in Hive.
trans-unit.target: External tables only store the table definition in Hive.

trans-unit.source: The data is left in the original location.
trans-unit.target: The data is left in the original location.

trans-unit.source: **ROW FORMAT** - Tells Hive how the data is formatted.
trans-unit.target: **ROW FORMAT** - Tells Hive how the data is formatted.

trans-unit.source: In this case, the fields in each log are separated by a space.
trans-unit.target: In this case, the fields in each log are separated by a space.

trans-unit.source: **STORED AS TEXTFILE LOCATION** - Tells Hive where the data is stored (the example/data directory), and that it is stored as text.
trans-unit.target: **STORED AS TEXTFILE LOCATION** - Tells Hive where the data is stored (the example/data directory), and that it is stored as text.

trans-unit.source: **SELECT** - Selects a count of all rows where column **t4** contains the value **[ERROR]**.
trans-unit.target: **SELECT** - Selects a count of all rows where column **t4** contains the value **[ERROR]**.

trans-unit.source: This should return a value of **3** as there are three rows that contain this value.
trans-unit.target: This should return a value of **3** as there are three rows that contain this value.

trans-unit.source: **INPUT__FILE__NAME LIKE '%.log'** - Tells Hive that we should only return data from files ending in .log.
trans-unit.target: **INPUT__FILE__NAME LIKE '%.log'** - Tells Hive that we should only return data from files ending in .log.

trans-unit.source: This restricts the search to the sample.log file that contains the data, and keeps it from returning data from other example data files that do not match the schema we defined.
trans-unit.target: This restricts the search to the sample.log file that contains the data, and keeps it from returning data from other example data files that do not match the schema we defined.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] External tables should be used when you expect the underlying data to be updated by an external source, such as an automated data upload process, or by another MapReduce operation, but always want Hive queries to use the latest data.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] External tables should be used when you expect the underlying data to be updated by an external source, such as an automated data upload process, or by another MapReduce operation, but always want Hive queries to use the latest data.

trans-unit.source: Dropping an external table does **not** delete the data, only the table definition.
trans-unit.target: Dropping an external table does **not** delete the data, only the table definition.

trans-unit.source: Use the following statements to create a new 'internal' table named **errorLogs**:
trans-unit.target: Use the following statements to create a new 'internal' table named **errorLogs**:

trans-unit.source: These statements perform the following actions:
trans-unit.target: These statements perform the following actions:

trans-unit.source: **CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS** - Creates a table, if it does not already exist.
trans-unit.target: **CREATE TABLE IF NOT EXISTS** - Creates a table, if it does not already exist.

trans-unit.source: Since the **EXTERNAL** keyword is not used, this is an internal table, which is stored in the Hive data warehouse and is managed completely by Hive.
trans-unit.target: Since the **EXTERNAL** keyword is not used, this is an internal table, which is stored in the Hive data warehouse and is managed completely by Hive.

trans-unit.source: **STORED AS ORC** - Stores the data in Optimized Row Columnar (ORC) format.
trans-unit.target: **STORED AS ORC** - Stores the data in Optimized Row Columnar (ORC) format.

trans-unit.source: This is a highly optimized and efficient format for storing Hive data.
trans-unit.target: This is a highly optimized and efficient format for storing Hive data.

trans-unit.source: **INSERT OVERWRITE ... SELECT** - Selects rows from the **log4jLogs** table that contain **[ERROR]**, then inserts the data into the **errorLogs** table.
trans-unit.target: **INSERT OVERWRITE ... SELECT** - Selects rows from the **log4jLogs** table that contain **[ERROR]**, then inserts the data into the **errorLogs** table.

trans-unit.source: To verify that only rows containing **[ERROR]** in column t4 were stored to the **errorLogs** table, use the following statement to return all the rows from **errorLogs**:
trans-unit.target: To verify that only rows containing **[ERROR]** in column t4 were stored to the **errorLogs** table, use the following statement to return all the rows from **errorLogs**:

trans-unit.source: Three rows of data should be returned, all containing **[ERROR]** in column t4.
trans-unit.target: Three rows of data should be returned, all containing **[ERROR]** in column t4.

trans-unit.source: [AZURE.NOTE] Unlike external tables, dropping an internal table will delete the underlying data as well.
trans-unit.target: [AZURE.NOTE] Unlike external tables, dropping an internal table will delete the underlying data as well.

trans-unit.source: Summary
trans-unit.target: Summary

trans-unit.source: As you can see, the Hive command provides an easy way to interactively run Hive queries on an HDInsight cluster, monitor the job status, and retrieve the output.
trans-unit.target: As you can see, the Hive command provides an easy way to interactively run Hive queries on an HDInsight cluster, monitor the job status, and retrieve the output.

trans-unit.target: Next steps
